content.raw:
@{557058:095b1e12-74ed-4e20-b44f-2f0745b616e0} I’m not sure this entirely answers the above question \(and mirrors some questions of my own\). What are the requirements on competition Docker images? 

Must they use the SUBT image as a base or do they only need to be API-compatible \(e.g., subscribe/publish on the correct ROS topics and use the CommsClient library with it’s ignition-based interface to the CommsBroker\)?
content.html:
@Nate Koenig I’m not sure this entirely answers the above question (and mirrors some questions of my own). What are the requirements on competition Docker images?

Must they use the SUBT image as a base or do they only need to be API-compatible (e.g., subscribe/publish on the correct ROS topics and use the CommsClient library with it’s ignition-based interface to the CommsBroker)?
